Articles.Content:
While you can kind of see them on the preceding picture they aren't well marked. Gemini had the following engines. 16 RCS on the nose of the Gemini Capsule fueled by tanks contained behind the engines themselves. These provided 3 axis movement and used after separation of the equipment section. The retrograde section had 6 RCS thrusters fueled by the tanks in the equipment section. 2 were retro engines for -Z movement, the other 4 were for translation x and y. The retrograde section also contained 4 solid motors to provide the necessary velocity change to return to Earth. The Equipment section had 10 engines. 2 were facing backwards for +Z translation. The other 8 were for X, Y, Z rotation.

Frizzank has done a good job replicating all these functions in his realistic parts.
ok, that makes sense.
Is 0.25 going to affect FASA in any way?
nvm, unable to download 0.25 atm

4.98

Works with .25

Decreased the amount of Default fuel in the Apollo SM

Increased APS rcs thrust

More pricing tweaks

Moved ascent and decent lem engines to meta materials

Removed TAC life support as modal manager handles it better

Updated to RPM 18.2

Tweaked ISP for J2 H1 and RL10 to be closer to real world values

RL10 is awesome in a vacuum and almost unusable at sea level now.

J-2 better vacuum ISP more thrust

H-1 now has worse ISP to reflect its purpose as an early booster engine and more thrust. Added some weight to the tanks to balance the added thrust.

F-1 has lower ISP

Saturn V and 1B and J2 tanks have room for more fuel if you like.

https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/27/FASA

Cool!

I take it that's all cfg changes?
Sorry no new parts this time...

Not criticizing, just clarifying!

BTW--not sure you got my PM a ways back. Would you prefer it if RO included the actual assets, with very explicit licensing, or as now asked people to come here to download the pack (at the risk of posting on this thread)?

Im just going to keep it here for now. Eventually I am going to make FASA open source and post all the source files, but that will be a while. Also it would be a huge pack to download. Something like 1.5 gigs, my Photoshop files are large....

I restarted KSP and the pod turned black but another restart saw it white again please advise if you need logs or anything happy to help where i can.

Thabks
What's modal manager?
That's absolutely fine (and frankly easier for us ) I just wanted to be sure we were doing your favored approach.

I restarted KSP and the pod turned black but another restart saw it white again please advise if you need logs or anything happy to help where i can.

can confirm me too

I am not seeing the issue, I have tested it on 3 different machines with fresh installs. Can you try to paste the new version over the old version to see if it fixes the issue.

old - http://www./download/dr9w154vwzc5076/FASA4.972.zip

new - http://www./download/dp6777dlieqt9p8/FASA4.98.zip
Thats seems to have fixed it for me thanks Frizzank

hmm tried the same approach but with no luck i thing the *.TGA is causing problems as it is bugged in this ksp release i think it needs new texture format or we wait for a ksp patch

on a side note this is happening at random fasa parts are pure white while the Orbital orb from HGR parts was good, on second load Orbital orb was also white and the on third try good again cant seem to find anything in logs thou

just thought I'd check before downloading, will anything in the new patch break a savegame if I have the previous version?

What's modal manager?

ModuleManager is the script that makes modding KSP possible, just put it in the gamedata folder. A lot of mods include it by default, as long as you have the most recent version, you don't need to install that file.

Edited October 8, 2014 by Capt. Hunt
Be brave and start fresh each release brings new challenges
Beale has confirmed that 0.25 has some bugs in its TGA loader; TGAs are no longer safe to use.

I am not seeing the issue, I have tested it on 3 different machines with fresh installs. Can you try to paste the new version over the old version to see if it fixes the issue.

I have not noticed any problems with it at all either. All the textures have been working just fine.

I'm hitting the same texture glitch. The (supposed to be) black Gemini pod, landing leg, and light are all stark white with no colour or shading. Their white counterparts are fine. Active Texture Management is NOTbeing used.

Edited October 9, 2014 by Jack Wolfe
Correcting a typo
Then ATM is at fault, there is nothing wrong with this mod.
raidernick: As I said above, .25 has issues with TGA loading. It doesn't occur for everyone, but it *is* an issue.

Its not ATM as I kind of started it off when I discovered I had white Mercury componets and I didnt have ATM installed, its a squad issue and I am guessing we will see hotfixes coming in the not to distant future to solve the issue
Im currently using tga's on parts because of another bug where only tga's mip map correctly....
